level.heading: DECLARATION OF CANDIDACY AND AFFIDAVIT OF QUALIFICATIONS (§ 3-601)

level.text: Each candidate for nomination shall declare his or her candidacy.
The affidavit (after this, “Declaration of Candidacy”) shall be on a form provided by the Board of Elections and Ethics.
The Declaration of Candidacy filed by the candidate shall contain the following information:
The name, address, and telephone number of the candidate;
The office which the candidate seeks;
The date of the election; and
The ward, Advisory Neighborhood Commission Single-Member District, or school district from which the candidate seeks election, where applicable;
The candidate’s party affiliation, where applicable;
The candidate’s residence addresses for the past three (3) years;
The candidate’s designation of how he or she would like his or her name to be listed on the ballot, in accordance with § 702 of this title; and
A statement that the candidate meets the qualifications for holding office.
The Declaration of Candidacy form shall contain a notice of the penalties for making false representation(s) as to one’s qualifications for holding elective office.
Each candidate shall swear or affirm upon oath before a District notary or Board official that the information provided in the Declaration is true to the best of the candidate’s knowledge and belief.
